result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Zingler

Defendant Ronald Zingler in court.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Ronald Zingler.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Status conference held. Defense needs to discuss veterans treatment court. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
State's Response to Suppression Motion, filed.

Defendant Ronald Zingler in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant informed the Court that he is in the process of obtaining private counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ronald Zingler in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ronald Zingler appeared by video means.  Defendant to try to hire counsel.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ronald Zingler in court.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BLJ and TL
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/16/2022@1:00pm
